title: Marvinswag
author: Marvinswag
content: Aye, i hope whoever sees this is doing well. Would a bitcoin ecosystem for gamers who play for more than 4hrs a day be a feature of bitcoin? I started executing on an application called Playgon Arena: an idea to help bridge the gap between doing what one loves and earning a living. The limitation of this idea is, it would only bridge that gap for gammers since they'll be rewarded for the wasted time if they play well or consecutively end up at the top 60-70% of the participants. I also believe in bitcoin and was hoping it could add its utility. However, I do not wish to develop a feature as a product. Would one consider this application a feature of bitcoin when it succeeds? What's the worst that could happen? Could utility layers be added to bitcoin to increase it's utility? I've read about the lightning network layer and web 5, would Playgon Arena be considered a utility layer for bitcoin such as those bitcoin features?

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: It's possible to enable smart contracts to be run of a side chain to bitcoins where checksums (eg hashes) for programs/assets etc are stored on bitcoin's blockchain and the actual data is stored somewhere else - like another blockchain or published centrally if needed.There are already things like esports competitions and live streaming that might already bridge that gap too between earning and gaming and take much less of a setup (if people are actively looking into getting things like that - it'd be a place to start).
